intro: Thryptomene orbiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thryptomene, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small white or pale pink flowers, typically in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Thryptomene orbiculata is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to survive in arid conditions.
